Stem: Young stems purplish and densely hairy, older stems brown and hairless.
Leaves: Dark green upper and paler below, 3-8 cm long, oval shaped, in opposite pairs on stems, with smooth edges and sometimes deeply lobed when young.
Flowers: Tubular, white to pink, turing yellow or orange with age, in pairs at leaf bases, very fragrant.
Habitat: Forests, woodlands, along streams, heathlands, disturbed areas.
DistinguishingFeatures: Unlikely to be confused when in flower.
